item.title: 解说员：新日铁和美国钢铁公司 150 亿美元巨额合并的下一步是什么？
item.description: 美国政府的一个专家小组将于本月就日本收购美国钢铁公司是否会威胁国家安全提出建议，而这一价值 150 亿美元的巨型并购案的命运将岌岌可危。【原文：A U.S. government panel is set to submit its recommendations this month on whether a Japanese takeover of U.S. Steel would threaten national security, with the fate of the $15 billion mega-merger in the balance.】

item.title: 英国央行将继续保持央行慢车道并按兵不动
item.description: 英国央行似乎将在下周继续按兵不动，因为它在削减借贷成本方面的行动要比欧洲和美国的央行缓慢。【原文：The Bank of England looks set to keep interest rates on hold next week as it moves more slowly to cut borrowing costs than central banks in Europe and the United States.】

item.title: 航空公司飞行员和机组人员对中东航线表示担忧
item.description: 9 月下旬，欧洲廉价航空公司 Wizz Air 的一名经验丰富的飞行员在得知他的飞机将在夜间飞越伊拉克上空时感到焦虑不安，因为附近的伊朗和以色列之间的紧张局势日益加剧。【原文：In late September, an experienced pilot at low-cost European airline Wizz Air felt anxious after learning his plane would fly over Iraq at night amid mounting tensions between nearby Iran and Israel.】

item.title: 股市为特朗普的胜利欢呼，但关税给 2025 年带来了未知数
item.description: 美国股市对唐纳德-特朗普在 2024 年总统大选中获胜表示欢迎，但如果当选总统兑现其关税威胁，未来可能会出现动荡。【原文：The U.S. stock market welcomed Donald Trump's victory in the 2024 presidential election, but turbulence may lie ahead if the president-elect makes good on his tariff threats.】

item.title: 瑞士处理瑞士信贷危机的判决将为瑞银定下基调
item.description: 一份关于瑞士当局如何处理瑞士信贷倒闭事件的报告将在未来几天内公布，这份报告期待已久，有可能为更严格地监管瑞士信贷的新东家瑞银集团（UBS）铺平道路。【原文：A long-awaited report on how Swiss authorities handled the collapse of Credit Suisse is due to be published in the coming days, potentially paving the way for stricter oversight of its new owner UBS .】

item.title: 早间竞标：价格完美融入 CPI
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: TikTok 加拿大分部寻求对关闭令进行司法审查
item.description: TikTok 加拿大分公司周二在一份声明中说，该公司向加拿大联邦法院提交了一份紧急动议，寻求对该公司出于国家安全考虑而关闭在该国业务的命令进行司法审查。【原文：TikTok's Canada unit filed an emergency motion with Canada's Federal Court seeking a judicial review of an order that the company shut down its operations in the country on national security concerns, it said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，贝恩将把富士软的出价提高至每股 9,600 日元，高于 KKR 的出价
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周三报道，美国私募股权公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）将把富士软的收购价从9,450日元提高到9,600日元（63.35美元），以对抗KKR的要约收购。【原文：U.S. private equity firm Bain Capital is set to raise its offer price for Fuji Soft to 9,600 yen ($63.35) from 9,450 yen to counter KKR's tender offer bid, the Nikkei business daily reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 洋葱》收购亚历克斯-琼斯的《Infowars》被美国法官叫停
item.description: 美国一名破产法官周二阻止模仿新闻网站洋葱（The Onion）收购阴谋论者亚历克斯-琼斯（Alex Jones）的 Infowars 网站，裁定破产拍卖没有产生最佳出价。【原文：A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Tuesday stopped the parody news site the Onion from buying conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' Infowars website, ruling that a bankruptcy auction did not result in the best possible bids.】

item.title: 解说：日本央行下周加息的可能性有多大？
item.description: 日本央行将于下周召开本年度最后一次政策会议，其决定将在美国联邦储备委员会预期降息几小时后公布。【原文：The Bank of Japan holds its final policy meeting for the year next week with its decision to be announced just hours after that of the U.S. Federal Reserve's expected interest rate cut.】

item.title: 特斯拉 12 月首周在华售出 21,900 辆电动汽车，创下第四季度最高纪录
item.description: 据特斯拉中国公司周三称，美国汽车制造商特斯拉12月第一周在中国售出2.19万辆电动汽车，创下2024年第四季度最高单周销量。【原文：U.S. automaker Tesla sold 21,900 electric vehicles in China in the first week of December, the highest weekly sales in the fourth quarter of 2024, according to Tesla China on Wednesday.】

item.title: 对立的液化天然气供应、萨哈林岛的气田枯竭让日本摆脱了俄罗斯天然气的束缚
item.description: 业内人士称，随着日本从俄罗斯萨哈林-2 项目获得液化天然气（LNG）的长期合同即将到期，竞争对手生产商看到了填补供应缺口的机会，即使东京希望转而使用更清洁的能源。【原文：As Japan's long-term contracts to secure liquefied natural gas (LNG) from Russia's Sakhalin-2 project near expiration, rival producers see opportunity to fill the supply gap, even as Tokyo looks to switch to cleaner energy, industry insiders say.】

item.title: 股市紧张等待美国 CPI
item.description: 周三，在加拿大降息预期和美国通胀数据预计将使美联储再次降息之前，亚洲股市和美元稍事喘息。【原文：Asian stock markets and the dollar took a breather on Wednesday ahead of an anticipated rate cut in Canada and a U.S. inflation reading expected to leave the Fed on course to cut rates again.】

item.title: EY 工人之死凸显印度白领劳工不受保护的现状
item.description: 在全球咨询公司安永（EY）的一位年轻高管去世后，印度两个推动其经济增长的邦的当局正在起草更严格的工作场所规则和检查措施，以保护白领员工。【原文：Authorities in two Indian states that are driving its economic growth are drafting tighter workplace rules and inspections to protect white collar employees following the death of a young executive at global consultancy Ernst & Young (EY), which her family blamed on overwork.】

item.title: 油价因中国 "宽松 "货币政策带来的需求希望而上扬
item.description: 周三早盘，油价小幅上涨，市场人士预计，在中国政府宣布采取宽松货币政策刺激经济增长之后，中国明年的需求将上升。【原文：Oil prices rose slightly early on Wednesday, with market participants expecting to see demand rising in China next year after Beijing announced a looser monetary policy to stimulate economic growth.】

item.title: 美元在 CPI 公布前保持坚挺，澳元在 4 个月低点附近徘徊
item.description: 周三，美元对日元汇率接近两周高点，此前备受瞩目的美国通胀数据可能为美联储的降息步伐提供线索。【原文：The dollar traded close to a two-week high versus the yen on Wednesday ahead of a highly anticipated reading of U.S. inflation that could provide clues on the pace of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 耶伦与韩国财政部长讨论韩国政治危机
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周二与韩国财政部长崔相木（Choi Sang-mok）进行了会谈，讨论了韩国总统尹锡烈上周试图实施戒严令后的政治动荡。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen spoke to South Korean Finance Minister Choi Sang-mok on Tuesday and discussed South Korea's political turmoil following President Yoon Suk Yeol's attempt last week to impose martial law.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，派对城正在酝酿第二次破产申请
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，在美国申请破产近两年后，Party City Holdco 公司正计划第二次申请破产，因为它将耗尽运营所需的现金。【原文：Party City Holdco Inc is planning a second bankruptcy filing nearly two years after it filed for one in the U.S. as it runs out of cash to run operations, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: OpenAI 首席财务官弗里尔表示，她相信马斯克会优先考虑国家利益
item.description: OpenAI 首席财务官莎拉-弗里尔（Sarah Friar）周二淡化了当选总统唐纳德-特朗普最亲密的顾问之一埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）对这家 ChatGPT 制造商的公开威胁。【原文：OpenAI's Chief Financial Officer Sarah Friar played down on Tuesday public threats to the ChatGPT maker from Elon Musk, one of President-elect Donald Trump’s closest advisors.】

item.title: 谷歌要求美国联邦贸易委员会拆散微软与 OpenAI 的云计算交易
item.description: 据 Information 周二报道，谷歌已要求美国政府解除微软在其云服务器上托管 OpenAI 技术的独家协议。【原文：Google has asked the U.S. government to break up Microsoft's exclusive agreement to host OpenAI's technology on its cloud servers, the Information reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日本 11 月批发通胀率上升
item.description: 周三的数据显示，11月份日本批发价格同比增长3.7%，比上月略有加快，表明企业继续面临原材料成本上涨的压力。【原文：Japan's wholesale prices increased 3.7% in November from a year earlier, data showed on Wednesday, accelerating slightly from the previous month in a sign companies continued to face pressure from rising raw material costs.】

item.title: 日经新闻》报道，日产汽车在管理层调整中将首席财务官马云调任为中国区负责人
item.description: 据《日经新闻》报道，日产汽车董事会已决定重新委派首席财务官马世民（Stephen Ma）领导其中国业务。【原文：Nissan Motor's board has decided to reassign Chief Financial Officer Stephen Ma to head its China business, the Nikkei newspaper reported, a high-profile shake-up for the crisis-hit Japanese automaker as it cuts thousands of jobs.】

item.title: 贝莱德首席运营官希望提高技术和人工智能能力
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc）首席运营官周二表示，该公司正在寻找机会扩大其技术能力，包括在人工智能领域。【原文：BlackRock Inc , the world's largest asset manager, is looking for opportunities to expand its technology capabilities including in the area of artificial intelligence, its chief operating officer said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 贝莱德认为，即使是 "温和 "降息后，投资者也会从现金转向股票
item.description: 贝莱德集团（BlackRock）首席财务官周二表示，即使美联储 "适度 "降息，投资者也会增加股票和债券的配置。【原文：Investors are expected to increase their allocations to stocks and bonds from cash after even "modest" Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, BlackRock's chief financial officer said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Blackstone 预计明年北美私募股权投资退出将翻一番
item.description: Blackstone 一位高层管理人员告诉路透社，Blackstone 预计并购环境的改善以及首次公开募股市场的回暖，将有助于该收购巨头在 2025 年出售和退出两倍以上的投资项目。【原文：Blackstone expects an improved environment for mergers and acquisitions and a pickup in the market for initial public offerings to help the buyout giant sell and exit more than twice the number of investments in 2025, a top executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 投资总监：谷歌最大的赌注是人工智能搜索
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 是自动驾驶汽车和量子计算领域的先驱，而它最大的赌注却离我们更近：在线搜索。【原文：Alphabet , the Google parent that has pioneered self-driving cars and quantum computing, is making its biggest bet much closer to home: online search.】

item.title: 日本制造商情绪 10 个月来首次转为消极
item.description: 路透社 Tankan 调查显示，由于对美国保护主义政策和中国经济的担忧，日本制造商的商业情绪在 12 月份进一步恶化，悲观者人数 10 个月来首次超过乐观者。【原文：Japanese manufacturers' business sentiment soured further in December amid worries over U.S. protectionist policies and the Chinese economy, with pessimists outnumbering optimists for the first time in 10 months, the Reuters Tankan survey found.】

item.title: 特朗普任命安德鲁-弗格森为美国联邦贸易委员会主席
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周二任命联邦贸易委员会委员安德鲁-弗格森（Andrew Ferguson）领导消费者保护和反垄断机构。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday tapped Federal Trade Commissioner Andrew Ferguson to lead the consumer protection and antitrust agency.】

item.title: 诉讼指控大型食品公司向儿童推销 "上瘾 "食品
item.description: 周二，包括卡夫亨氏（Kraft Heinz）、蒙代尔（Mondelez）和可口可乐（Coca-Cola）在内的大型食品公司在美国遭遇新的诉讼，指控它们设计和销售 "超加工 "食品，使儿童上瘾，并导致慢性疾病。【原文：Major food companies, including Kraft Heinz , Mondelez and Coca-Cola , were hit with a new lawsuit in the U.S. on Tuesday accusing them of designing and marketing "ultra-processed" foods to be addictive to children, causing chronic disease.】

item.title: 因复苏缓慢和管理层变动，标普全球下调英特尔信用评级
item.description: S&P全球评级公司周二将芯片制造商英特尔公司的信用评级从 "BBB+"下调至 "BBB"，原因是该公司业务恢复缓慢，管理层变动后存在不确定性。【原文：S&P Global Ratings on Tuesday downgraded chipmaker Intel Corp's credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB+', on slow business recovery and uncertainty following management changes.】
